# News comment title:
A Stark Choice: Ted Cruz’s Jacksonian Americanism vs. Marco Rubio’s Wilsonian Internationalism

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
I've crossed the Rubio-con.

I ain't falling for his fairytales again.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
I've crossed the Rubio-con.

I ain't falling for his fairytales again.

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


Sorry.  I can't look at that picture of those B24s over Europe without thinking of the 8 or 10 young men in each one flying through that flak filled sky.  

They knew what they were doing and what they had to do.  They knew the cost.  They paid the cost. 

THEIR President was not ashamed of their sacrifice.  That would be a notion beyond comprehension.

What a different world.

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# News comment title:
Constitutional Scholar: It’s Fair To Discuss Cruz Citizenship Issue

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
This will be brought up in the debate. It will be interesting what happens. You know they will push for a Cruz and Trump fight.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
C'mon Breitbart, how many of these birther articles are you going to print? We get it that you prefer the reality TV star over the Constitutional conservative. You've made your point, despite what the vast majority of rational legal scholars have said. So why not just endorse Trump and find some truthful news to report?

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


Pretty sure that you are spot on with how  ANY Supreme Court would decide these days.

The thought that USSC limiting rights to vote, run for office, run for penultimate office, etc., be predicated on race or gender of parent is too farfetched to be tenable.

(Can't have 'originalist' argument -as weak as that is anyway - without going whole hog.)

Certain however that Democrats will try.  But look at how well the 'Trump is a misogynist' went for Clinton.  

I wonder if Cruz could, like Trump, benefit from opponents' desperation.

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# News comment title:
Texas Lawyer Files Suit to Challenge Ted Cruz’s ‘Natural Born Citizen’ Eligibility

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
No one even DARED to do this with Obysmal.!

And his heritage just SCREAMS to be investigated.!!!!!!!!!

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
No one even DARED to do this with Obysmal.!

And his heritage just SCREAMS to be investigated.!!!!!!!!!

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


'Enumerated' just means that prior to an election, somebody goes from door to door collecting names prior to making official list. Doesn't mean 'voted'.

Red herring.

Real issue is whether today 'natural' means common sense: " of an American parent, or born in USA".  

Else it could be parsed back to absurd and offensive anachronisms.  Courts don't like that and will apply 'back-pressure' to evade it.

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# News comment title:
Despite cold, balloons fly at Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
That was a great parade. WHAT GLOBAL WARMING?

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
From NASA: Long cold winter could hit space in months bringing record low temperatures, NASA has warned.

That's the warning from a scientist who fears sunspot activity on the surface of our star has dropped so low that record low temperatures could soon set in.

“We see a cooling trend,” says Martin Mlynczak of NASA’s Langley Research Center.

“High above Earth’s surface, near the edge of space, our atmosphere is losing heat energy.

"If current trends continue, it could soon set a Space Age record for cold.”

Solar minimum can enhance the effects of space weather, disrupt communications and navigation, and even cause space junk to "hang around", NASA said.

Mlynczak and his colleagues have recently introduced the "Thermosphere Climate Index" (TCI), which measure how much heat nitric oxide (NO) molecules are dumping into space.

The results come from the SABER instrument onboard NASA’s TIMED satellite, that monitor infrared emissions from carbon dioxide (CO2) and nitric oxide (NO).

By measuring the infrared glow of these molecules, SABER can assess the thermal state of gas at the very top of the atmosphere – a layer researchers call “the thermosphere.”

When the thermosphere cools, it shrinks, making the radius of the Earth's atmosphere smaller.

This means it can delay the natural decay of space junk, resulting in a more cluttered environment around Earth.

“Right now, it is very low indeed,” Mlynczak told Space Weather.

“SABER is currently measuring 33 billion Watts of infrared power from NO. That’s 10 times smaller than we see during more active phases of the solar cycle.”

“The thermosphere always cools off during Solar Minimum. It’s one of the most important ways the solar cycle affects our planet,” explains Mlynczak.

“We’re not there quite yet,” he said of the record cold, “but it could happen in a matter of months."

The most famous example of a prolonged sunspot minimum is the Maunder Minimum, referring to a period around 1645 to 1715 during which sunspots become exceedingly rare.

Maunder coincided with the middle part of the Little Ice Age, when Europe and North America experienced colder temperatures - fueling speculation that the two were connected.

Actually, for me, the problematic word is ‘populism’ - the others at least have concise meanings. 

I get that ‘Populism’ has now become some sort of swear-word, but I wish someone could properly define it. 

It seems to have something to do with “will of the common folk” versus “decree of the elite”.  

I get “common folk” - it seems to mean “regular folk ” viewed pejoratively.  But what are “elite”?

Far as I can tell, it means:  “Those that view themselves as cognitively and awareness(ly) superior to the ‘common folk’, and have economic and peer-group advantages that allow them to self-posit themselves as ‘elites’, and act accordingly.”  

In other words: those that sneer at the rest of us, and got the bucks to try and bend us to their will. 

Sigh ... I wish every time some politician or polemicist used the word,  they would get asked: “Define what you MEAN by ‘populism’.”
